issue.title: several urdf models appear to be missing head link

content.raw:
the files in [`atlas_description/urdf`](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/atlas_description/urdf/?at=default) are used by files in [`atlas_description/robots`](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/atlas_description/robots/?at=default) to generate full robot models.  So, yes, these urdf files are needed.  And the way to use these urdf component files is to invoke [xacro](http://ros.org/wiki/xacro), e.g., similar to your launch script reference, commandline usage below:
~~~
rosrun xacro xacro.py `rospack find atlas_description`/robots/atlas.urdf.xacro
~~~

Referencing pull request #408, we now generate full models and install them into the install targets  at compile time (see issue #373 for more discussions).

Note, the `head` links are included when full robot configuration is used.  For example, take a look at [`atlas.urdf.xacro`](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/atlas_description/robots/atlas.urdf.xacro?at=default), it simply refers to different parts of the robot:
~~~
<robot xmlns:xacro="http://www.ros.org/wiki/xacro" name="atlas" >
  <xacro:include filename="$(find atlas_description)/urdf/atlas_simple_shapes.urdf" />
  <xacro:include filename="$(find atlas_description)/urdf/atlas.gazebo" />
  <xacro:include filename="$(find atlas_description)/urdf/atlas.transmission" />
  <xacro:include filename="$(find multisense_sl_description)/urdf/multisense_sl.urdf" />
</robot>
~~~
where the line
~~~
  <xacro:include filename="$(find multisense_sl_description)/urdf/multisense_sl.urdf" />
~~~
pulls in the head link through [`multisense_sl.urdf`](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/multisense_sl_description/urdf/multisense_sl.urdf?at=default).
